info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 31 at 9:39PM MDT until August 1 at 4:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque NM
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Mexico...
Embudo Creek Below Dixon affecting Rio Arriba County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Embudo Creek below Dixon.
* WHEN...Until late tonight.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 9.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 13.4 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 400 AM MDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT
